dc:description: ATP-binding cassette subfamily C, member 6 (*ABCC6*) was first reported in relation to autosomal dominant/autosomal recessive pseudoxanthoma elasticum (PXE) in 2000 by three research groups (Ringpfeil et al., PMID 10811882; Bergen et al., PMID 10835643; Le Saux et al., PMID 10835642). Pseudoxanthoma elasticum is characterized by calcifications that manifest subcutaneously in yellow papules, in the eyes as angioid streaks or in arterial walls. A more severe presentation of disease was first reported in 2012 as autosomal recessive generalized arterial calcification of infancy (GACI) which had previously only been linked to biallelic variation in *ENPP1* (Nitschke et al., PMID 22200248). Per criteria outlined by the ClinGen Lumping and Splitting guidelines, we found no difference in molecular mechanism or phenotypic spectrum. Therefore, the following disease entities have been lumped into one disease entity, pseudoxanthoma elasticum (AR; OMIM:264800), generalized arterial calcification of infancy 2 (AR; OMIM:614473) and forme fruste pseudoxanthoma elasticum (AD; OMIM:177850). The association of monoallelic *ABCC6* variation and PXE is debated in the literature, however, heterozygous variant carriers have been documented with clinical and/or histopathological indications of PXE as well as a potential for increased cardiovascular calcification or stroke (PMIDs 40725385, 29722917). 18 variants (3 nonsense, 6 missense, 6 frameshift, 2 splice-site, 1 multi-exon deletion) that have been reported in 17 probands in 4 publications (PMIDs: 10811882, 10835643, 22209248, 29709427) are included in this curation. More evidence is available in the literature, but the maximum score for genetic evidence has been reached. The mechanism of pathogenicity is known to be loss of function. This gene-disease relationship is also supported by animal models, rescue in a mouse model, and biochemical evidence (PMIDs: 16135817, 36769695, 28416300). Biallelic knockout of *ABCC6* in mouse models recapitulates the calcification phenotype seen in humans as well as the reduction in circulating inorganic pyrophosphate (ppi) which has been reported as an inhibitor of calcification. It was also shown that while there is a significant reduction in ppi between controls and PXE patients, there was not a connection between the severity of phenotypes and the measured ppi levels. In summary, there is definitive evidence supporting the relationship between *ABCC6* and semidominant *ABCC6*-related generalized arterial calcification. This has been repeatedly demonstrated in both the research and clinical diagnostic settings, and has been upheld over time. This classification was approved by the ClinGen Neurovascular Disease GCEP on the meeting date October 22, 2025 (SOP Version 11).

evidence.dc:description: The generalized calcification phenotype is a hallmark of this condition in human patients and the mouse model reproduces this virtually identically.
Generalized calcifications were observed in the same tissues in the mouse model as would be typical in a human pseudoxanthoma elasticum, however early onset calcification (>3wks) was not observed.
evidence.rdfs:label: Mouse ABCC6 -/-

evidence.dc:description: WT human ABCC6 was able to rescue circulating ppi levels and to greatly reduce tissue calcification, though the effect was more prominent in kidney tissue than in vibrissae.
evidence.rdfs:label: Rescue of plasma ppi and calcification phenotype in mice

evidence.dc:description: Inorganic phosphate (ppi) is an inhibitor of calcification in the body and ABCC6 variants associated with pseudoxanthoma elasticum have been found to reduce circulating levels of ppi. The authors note that this occurs in a dose dependent manner with biallelic carriers having the lowest ppi and heterozygous carriers having circulating ppi between controls and biallelic carriers. The extent of ppi reduction however does not correlate with disease severity.
evidence.rdfs:label: Plasma pyrophosphate in ABCC6 variant carriers

evidence.dc:description: absent from gnomAD v4.1
gnomAD v4.1 Grpmax FAF 0.00002665 (42/1180022 EnF)

evidence.rdfs:label: Nitschke_P6
evidence.detectionMethod: For cases without biallelic ENPP1 variation, ABCC6 was screened for variants. MLPA was used to screen for larger structural variants
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: aortic calcification, renal artery calcification, pulmonary artery calcification, diverse artery calcification

evidence.dc:description: gnomAD v4.1 Grpmax FAF 0.00002977 (4/44892 east Asian) - downscore 0.5pts for consanguinity - downscore 0.5pts for homozygosity

evidence.rdfs:label: Ringpfeil_F2:Proband
evidence.detectionMethod: ABCC6 PCR amplified and analyzed by heteroduplex scanning by using conformation-sensitive gel electrophoresis, aberrant bands were isolated and sequenced. Family members were assayed the same way or genotyped by either Sanger or restriction digest for the familial variant(s)
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: Limited specific phenotypes but descriptions of ophthalmologic and cutaneous findings consistent with pseudoxanthoma elasticum are reported for all probands in the cohort

evidence.rdfs:label: Bergen_FamilyP12

member.rdfs:label: Bergen_P-12
member.detectionMethod: Southern-blot, PCR assay, SSCP and direct Sanger sequencing of ABCC1 and ABCC6
member.phenotypeFreeText: PXE diagnosis based on ophthalmological, dermatological and cardiovascular examination. Minimal criteria: angioid streaks, typical skin lesions (confirmed by biopsy) or family history of PXE, cardiovascular features not investigated for all probands

evidence.phenotypeFreeText: PXE diagnosis based on ophthalmological, dermatological and cardiovascular examination. Minimal criteria: angioid streaks, typical skin lesions (confirmed by biopsy) or family history of PXE, cardiovascular features not investigated for all probands

evidence.dc:description: downscore 0.5 for homozygosity - gnomAD v4.1 Grpmax FAF 0.001948 (165/74130 African/African American) - not reported to be a founder variant but the frequency in the African/African American population is 10x that of the next highest population - There are many reports of affected individuals with pseudoxanthoma elasticum OR generalized arterial calcification in infancy in the literature and ClinVar
Expression in HEK293 (ABCC6 has highest expression in liver and second highest in kidney) shows protein level and surface expression of variant ABCC6 to be <20% of WT (PMID 27994049)

evidence.phenotypeFreeText: aortic/pulmonary/renal artery calcification, stippled calcification of: femora, pelvic cartilage, larynx and mandible, cardiac dysfunction

evidence.dc:description: expected to cause out of frame exon 21 skipping - gnomAD v4.1 Grpmax FAF 0.000393 (501/1179988 EnF)

SpliceAI predicts donor loss and donor gain, which would affect exon 27. Exon skipping alone would result in an in-frame deletion but the donor gain would predict then a frame-shift and early termination before the NMD boundary. The authors report the frame-shift consequence based on in silico tools - gnomAD v4.1 Grpmax FAF 0.0003933 (501/1179988 EnF)

evidence.rdfs:label: Bertamino_Case2
evidence.detectionMethod: NGS panel built to detect genes associated with pediatric stroke: ABCC6, ACTA2, ATP7A, CBS, CECR1, COL4A1, ELN, GLA, HTRA1, JAG1, NF1, NOTCH3, PCNT, SAMHD1, SLC2A10
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: right-sided partial seizures, ipsilateral gaze deviation, radial and femoral pulses were difficult to palpate, acute ischemic infarct in the left fronto-insular region, left middle cerebral artery sub-occlusion, bilateral segmental ICAs agenesis, carotid rete mirabile, left vertebral artery stenosis, Infrarenal aortic tapering and bilateral stenosis of the external iliac arteries with a network of collateral vessels, femoral artery biopsy revealed fragmentation of the elastic fibers in the vessel wall
